TF050093-GEF2 PDF B -
            MOLDOVA:PREPARATION OF AGRICULTURAL POLLUTION CONTROL PROJ,TF053023-GEF3 FSP-MOLDOVA:AGRICULTURAL
            POLLUTION CONTROL PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The Agricultural Pollution Control
            Project aims to  increase significantly the use o f
            environmentally friendly agricultural practices by farmers
            and agro-industry in Moldova in order to reduce nutrient
            discharge from agricultural sources to the Danube River and
            Black Sea. The project has four components. The first
            component has two subcomponents. It promotes mitigation
            measures for reducing nutrient loads in water bodies. This
            component provides grants to entrepreneurs and enterprises
            under the Rural Investment and Services Project (RISP) for
            investing in environmentally sustainable agricultural
            practices; and trains rural advisory service providers in
            several nutrient reduction practices, including crop
            nutrient management, conservation tillage practices, crop
            rotation and tree planting o f buffer strips etc. The first
            component also promotes improving watershed management
            practices, particularly manure management practices,
            environmentally-friendly agricultural practices, shrub and
            tree planting, wetland restoration and sustainable
            management practices, and the monitoring of soil, water
            quality, and environmental impacts. The second component
            strengthens national policy, regulatory enforcement and
            national capacity. The third component supports public
            information campaigns and a replication strategy. The fourth
            component finances project management and evaluation.
